lead_paragraph: PILSNER--Joyce, died April 14 2016. A native of NYC, she excelled in school graduating at 15 from Hunter High School and at 19 from Hunter College. She earned an MA from Columbia and a Certificate in Business Management from Columbia Business School. Her career began as a NYC High School science teacher and guidance counselor, then an administrator at Sarah Lawrence, then becoming Executive Director of Riverdale Mental Health Association for 35 years where she developed services for both youth and adults. She was devoted to her community and served as Chair of CB8 on which she sat for 25 years. She helped found The Coalition as well as Riverdale Senior Services and received many awards, including Riverdalian of the Year. Predeceased by her beloved Harry, she is survived by her daughter Toby and granddaughters Ariel and Halley whom she adored, as well as her sister Rhoda, niece Amy, nephews Scott and Alan and their families. 1/3
